intro: Tenoria tenuis, commonly known as the slender tenoria, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia and is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in temperate climates. Its leaves are narrow and finely divided, contributing to its delicate appearance. Tenoria tenuis is often found in alpine meadows and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological adaptations.
